issue.title: Fix comparison of nullable values

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Handle comparison of nullable values
 - add a test that reproduces the issue
 - extend `SqlNullabilityProcessor` to handle comparisons of nullable values
 - cleanup code that was needed because of missing handling of comparisons

Fixes #33752

body:
Some generalizations/similar simplifications:

1. `CASE WHEN t1 THEN x WHEN t2 THEN x  ... WHEN tn THEN x ELSE x END` â†’ `x`
This should be safe even for impure `x` ðŸŽ‰
3. `CASE WHEN boolExpr THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END` â†’ `boolExpr`
4. `CASE WHEN NOT (boolExpr) THEN x ELSE y END` â†’ `CASE WHEN boolExpr THEN y ELSE x END`
5. `NOT (CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN x ELSE y END)` â†’ `CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN NOT(x) ELSE NOT(y) END`
âš ï¸ it can improve or worsen the complexity of the query
6. `NOT (CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END)` â†’ `CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN FALSE ELSE TRUE END`
This is the query in the top comment and is relevant because it is emitted within EFCore; this specialization of the previous case always improves the query.
6. `NOT (COALESCE(nullOrBoolExpr, FALSE))` -> `COALESCE(NOT(nullOrBoolExpr), TRUE)`
is the `COALESCE` version of the previous rule. It does not improve the complexity of the query, but additional simplifications might be possible on `NOT(nullOrBoolExpr)`

issue.title: Simplify NOT (CASE ... THEN const) by pushing NOT into the THEN/ELSE

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
This is an implementation of the optimization suggested in https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/33857

Fixes #33857

issue.title: Additional optimization suggestions for CASE

repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Some generalizations/similar simplifications:

1. `CASE WHEN t1 THEN x WHEN t2 THEN x  ... WHEN tn THEN x ELSE x END` â†’ `x`
This should be safe even for impure `x` ðŸŽ‰
3. `CASE WHEN boolExpr THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END` â†’ `boolExpr`
4. `CASE WHEN NOT (boolExpr) THEN x ELSE y END` â†’ `CASE WHEN boolExpr THEN y ELSE x END`
5. `NOT (CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN x ELSE y END)` â†’ `CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN NOT(x) ELSE NOT(y) END`
âš ï¸ it can improve or worsen the complexity of the query
6. `NOT (CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END)` â†’ `CASE WHEN nullOrBoolExpr THEN FALSE ELSE TRUE END`
This is the query in the top comment and is relevant because it is emitted within EFCore; this specialization of the previous case always improves the query.
6. `NOT (COALESCE(nullOrBoolExpr, FALSE))` -> `COALESCE(NOT(nullOrBoolExpr), TRUE)`
is the `COALESCE` version of the previous rule. It does not improve the complexity of the query, but additional simplifications might be possible on `NOT(nullOrBoolExpr)`

_Originally posted by @ranma42 in https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/33857#issuecomment-2143556508_
